Whatever research you want to believe must come from a peer reviewed source. This gives other established experts in that field the opportunity to fact check said research and if it passes it can be published as legitimate research. In other words, don't take some "scientists" word for something because they are getting paid to say it.
Always look at who is funding the research before you go jumping head long onto their bandwagon. Things are not always what they seem.

I've never seen one of these before, it definately is pretty old. The leads are definately not original. The resistance scale is measured in ohms and is included on the bottom of the volt meter. The mystery screw thing looks like some kind of adjustment for calibrating the meter. Usually to measure resistance a small electrical charge is sent through whatever you are testing so this thing might need some type of battery.

One time when I was in the military my buddy and I were driving through Arkansas and stopped at a diner to get some lunch. We get seated and the kid taking our order asks in a thick southern accent "ya'll here for the ralley?". We were both from up north and we had no idea what he was talking about. Anyway about 10 minutes later these 5 mother fuckers wearing white sheets (minus the hood) come strolling in for lunch and sit down across the room from us. Both me and my friend just look at each other like you gotta be shitting me, the fucking KKK just walked in which means a KKK ralley is gonna happen. I thought that shit died out in the 60's but there they were. So the kid comes back and we ask him where and when it's going to be...downtown at noon. It was almost noon so we hang out then go check it out. Holly shit...there were maybe 20 klan guys all decked out with their pointy hats that were surrounded by maybe 100 very pissed off black people so we just kept on going.

I was in the military and stationed in Fairbanks Alaska from 99 to 03. I was constantly surrounded by such natural beauty that I wanted to capture it. I bought a used Minolta x-370 to start with and started reading online how to take good photos. I soon moved up to a Minolta x-700 because it had depth of field preview which is really handy when taking landscape shots. I eventually learned the down side to using print film (you don't get consistent results from the development people) so I switched to slide film because back around 2000 digital wasn't around yet. When I made the switch my shots started coming out the way I actually saw them which was what I had been looking for. Eventually I got into digital and have recently gotten back into film with an old Minolta SRT-101 because it's fun to get your pics back from the lab and you don't have to jack around with a computer to look at them on a screen.

I live near Dallas, this time of year has really nice cirrus clouds that add to an otherwise "dead" scenic shot. I like finding old abandoned houses out in the country for something different. There has been some really nice sunrises and sunsets lately. It was very humid out lately as well which gave all the dead grass a richer brown color along with old stone buildings. There is stuff out there just gotta get out and look around.

I lived there for a year and a half, when you get off the strip it's just like any other same sized city. There are a lot of good hiking and mountain biking trails in the area. I was born and raised in Michigan and lived 3 miles from Lake Michigan. I have also lived in Fairbanks Alaska for 4 years, it is awesome there and I want to go back. I lived in Shreveport Louisiana for 5 years and that area is shitty. Also lived in Las Vegas for 1.5 years, it was ok...lots of hiking and mountain biking but the schools are not good for the kids. I've also lived in Texas for 6 years now, it's a good place to raise a family because there are a lot of opportunities here and the schools are pretty good. Been through Canada twice on the way to Alaska and really liked it. Lived in Germany for 4 years and traveled all over Europe, it was nice but it was great to be back in the US.
It's my personal favorite country.
1. USA 2. Canada 3. Germany 4. Italy 5. France
